content.full_text:
Abraham Lincoln to John M. McCalla, 24 January 18481 Will MrMcCallaplease examine these papers, and inform me whether any thing, and if so, what, can
               be done in the case?–2
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to John M. McCalla, 24 January 18481

Will MrMcCallaplease examine these papers, and inform me whether any thing, and if so, what, can
               be done in the case?–2
citations: Abraham Lincoln to John M. McCalla;Abraham Lincoln to John M. McCalla.

footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed this letter.

2The enclosed papers Lincoln references were not with this letter, and they have not
                  been found.  No docketing accompanies the letter, so few clues exist as to the case
                  Lincoln mentions, but Lincoln’s other correspondence with John M. McCalla during this
                  period suggests that Lincoln was assisting one of his constituents in securing back
                  pay and land warrants for a  son or other relative who died in the line of duty during
                  theMexican War.Abraham Lincoln to John M. McCalla;Abraham Lincoln to John M. McCalla.
